title: Deepening Mathematical Concept Learning Through Reflective Abstraction: Application to Social Issues

context.prior_knowledge: Basic arithmetic operations, graph interpretation skills, and general understanding of social phenomena
context.additional_context: Situational need for mathematical analysis of social phenomena to improve workplace efficiency; ensuring accessibility via smartphone-based learning

learning_goals: Learners can explain the essential structure of mathematical concepts (ratios, rates of change, functions) through reflective abstraction processes.
Learners can convert social issues (population distribution, economic indicators, etc.) into mathematical models and document the interpretation process.
Learners demonstrate over 80% accuracy by correcting conceptual application errors based on formative assessment feedback.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
